g.text: (Multiple swarm machines can be used at the same time to increase scale)
Each agent needs to run multiple containers to function, and these containers cannot co-exist under the same
Podman graphroot. A separate graphroot is made for each agent in the swarm to ensure that the container
names don't clash. However, all agent Podman configurations make use of the shared image store as
an AdditionalImageStore, to avoid repeatedly pulling the same images. The shared image store, along with all the
different graphroots for each agent are all stored in a tmpfs on the RAM - otherwise performance would be
too slow and would limit the number of agents that can run on the same swarm machine
